item.title: Stocks Erase 2025 Slide as Nvidia Leads Tech Surge: Markets Wrap
item.description: A rally in the world’s largest technology companies wiped out the stock market’s losses for the year on speculation tensions around President Donald Trump’s trade war are cooling, with the latest inflation data showing limited impacts thus far.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: Oil Rises as Trump Threatens Iranian Crude If Nuclear Deal Fails
item.description: Oil continued its recovery from the year’s lows as US President Donald Trump threatened to ramp up sanctions against Iranian crude if a nuclear deal with the OPEC member isn’t reached.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Alex Longley

item.title: Hedge Funds Drop Lawsuits Against LME Over Nickel Crisis
item.description: A group of hedge funds that sued the London Metal Exchange over the 2022 nickel crisis have dropped their legal action after similar arguments made in separate proceedings were rejected by UK courts.
item.dc:creator: Jack Farchy, Jeremy Hodges

media:content.media:description: Traders on the trading floor of the open outcry pit at the London Metal Exchange Ltd. (LME) in London, U.K., on Monday, Sept. 6, 2021. After 18 months away, brokers returned Monday to the red leather couches of the London Metal Exchange’s floor, where they set benchmark prices of metals such as copper and aluminum by screaming orders at one another. Photographer: Jason Alden/Bloomberg

item.title: Romania Raises €1.6 Billion in Local Debt Before Tight Vote
item.description: Romania sold more euro-denominated debt on the domestic market than planned, rushing to fill up state coffers ahead of a contentious presidential run-off that’s weighed on the the country’s assets.
item.dc:creator: Peter Laca, Irina Vilcu

media:content.media:description: Campaign posters for presidential candidates in Bucharest.

item.title: Latin American Currencies Rally After Softer US Inflation Data
item.description: Latin American currencies led gains across emerging markets on Tuesday, after a softer-than-expected US inflation print stoked investor optimism.
item.dc:creator: Leda Alvim, Andras Gergely

item.title: UK Ethanol Plants Face Closure as Trade Deal Boosts US Flows
item.description: The UK’s biggest ethanol producers could be forced to halt production due to increased tariff-free imports of the fuel from the US.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Graham

item.title: L’Oreal Gets Ready For Its US Blue-Chip Bond Market Debut
item.description: L’Oreal SA is preparing to sell investment-grade notes on Tuesday, in what would be the makeup company’s first time borrowing in the US corporate bond market.
item.dc:creator: Ethan M Steinberg

item.title: Oil Traders Double Down on Bets for 45% Rally in Coming Months
item.description: Oil traders are continuing to ramp up long-shot options bets that Brent crude can rally toward $95 a barrel over the coming months.
item.dc:creator: Alex Longley, Mia Gindis

item.title: We Will Continue to See The Consumer Spend Says Nancy Tengler
item.description: Wall Street strategists are rapidly changing their forecasts for the S&P 500 Index due to President Trump's frequent policy reversals and announcements. Strategists such as Ed Yardeni and David Kostin of Goldman Sachs have recently raised their year-end targets for the S&P 500, citing improved trade negotiations and lower tariff rates. The frequent changes in forecasts highlight the challenge of predicting the market's trajectory under Trump's presidency, with some economists warning that the negative impact of tariffs may still be felt in the months ahead. Nancy Tengler is the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Investment Officer of Laffer Tengler Investments to discuss her outlook on the markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Hess Blames Tariffs for Delaying Toy Truck Release
item.description: Hess Corp., the US oil producer widely known for its signature green-and-white toy trucks, said the release of a collection of new miniature vehicles was delayed because of trade tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Crowley

media:content.media:description: The green and white Hess toy truck. Photographer: Hand-out/Hess Corporation

item.title: Egg Prices Fall to $5 a Dozen in the US From Record Highs
item.description: Egg prices pulled back 18% from a record high last month, offering some relief as supplies recovered from bird flu shock.
item.dc:creator: Ilena Peng, Gerson Freitas Jr

media:content.media:description: A shopper picks up eggs at a grocery store in New York.

item.title: Chicago Taps Loop Capital Founder to Fix $1 Billion Hole
item.description: Loop Capital founder Jim Reynolds​​​​ will co-lead a working group established by Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson to find ways for the city to close its deficits that are projected to top $1 billion in each of the next two years.
item.dc:creator: Shruti Singh

media:content.media:description: A Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) L train in the River North neighborhood of Chicago, Illinois, US, on Tuesday, Aug. 13, 2024. Roughly 50,000 people are expected in Chicago for the DNC, and local leaders are keen to buff up Chicago’s pandemic-dinged image as Chicago’s transit system overall ridership sat at 60% of pre-pandemic passenger levels at the start of 2024.

item.title: Colombian Oil Sector Seeks Protection From a Wave of Sabotage
item.description: Colombia’s oil and gas association urged authorities to take “urgent action” after a surge in sabotage attacks on critical energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Jaramillo

media:content.media:description: Pumpjacks operate near the Ecopetrol SA refinery stands in Barrancabermeja, Santander, Colombia, on Friday, April 20, 2018. Colombia's state-run oil company contained a spill in late March after more than 20 days and approximately 550 barrels of crude oil flowed into water sources in the Santander province. Photographer: Nicolo Filippo Rosso/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Tariff Flip-Flops Keep Stock Market Forecasters Swinging
item.description: A turbulent stock market is forcing some wild swings in expectations from Wall Street’s leading prognosticators.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) on May 13, 2025.

item.title: Bloomberg Surveillance 05/13/2025
item.description: Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern speak daily with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: JLR Withholds Guidance as Carmaker Grapples With Trump Tariffs
item.description: Jaguar Land Rover joined a growing list of carmakers holding back from providing profit guidance, as US President Donald Trump’s higher tariffs continue to wreak havoc on the industry.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Sachdev, Jamie Nimmo

media:content.media:description: Range Rover SUV in the paintshop at Tata Motors Ltd.'s manufacturing plant in Solihull, UK.

item.title: Phillips 66 Holders Should Vote for Four Elliott Nominees, ISS Says
item.description: Shareholders of Phillips 66 should vote for all four board candidates nominated by activist investor Elliott Investment Management in its upcoming annual meeting, said proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services Inc.
item.dc:creator: Crystal Tse

media:content.media:description: The Phillips 66 Los Angeles refinery in Wilmington, California, US, on Thursday, March 21, 2024. Phillips 66 is scheduled to release earnings figures on April 26.

item.title: Buyout Firms Ramp Up Debt Deals to Pay Dividends
item.description: Companies are launching a number of debt deals designed to pay out a dividend to their private equity owners, at a time when buyout firms are under pressure to return money to clients.
item.dc:creator: Abhinav Ramnarayan, Eleanor Duncan, Rachel Graf

item.title: Hedge Fund Insider Sees Dollar Rout as Biggest Players Eye Exit
item.description: As the founder of Exante Data, a bespoke Wall Street research firm tracking global money flows, Jens Nordvig regularly talks to the world’s largest investors, from hedge fund managers and corporate treasurers to pensions and sovereign wealth funds.
item.dc:creator: Anya Andrianova, Ye Xie

media:content.media:description: Jens Nordvig, chief executive officer of Exante Data.

item.title: Relief Rally Is Overdone, Says JPM's Kelly
item.description: David Kelly, JPMorgan Asset Management chief global strategist, expects inflation to pick up in the short term because of tariffs and he says the US relief rally may be overdone. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Stock Rally Continues as Ebbing Consumer Prices Buoy Optimism
item.description: A widening stock-market rally pushed US stocks higher for the year amid optimism over a pause in the trade war between the US and China and signs of easing inflation.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: MIT, Yale Face Endowment Tax Hike While Notre Dame Scores Break
item.description: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology said a Republican plan to raise taxes on college endowments would threaten US interests.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Albright, Janet Lorin

media:content.media:description: A student walks through Library Walk at Yale University campus in New Haven, Connecticut, US, on Sunday April 7, 2024. A Bloomberg News analysis of more than 1,500 nonprofit four-year colleges shows the return on investment at many elite private institutions outside the eight Ivies is no better than far-less selective public universities.

item.title: Dollar’s Big Bounce Meets a Wall of Doubt in Options Market
item.description: The dollar pared Monday’s gains, with traders unconvinced that the currency’s recent surge on the back of easing US-China trade tensions will last long and strategists forecasting continued weakness in the months ahead.
item.dc:creator: Vassilis Karamanis

item.title: US Bonds Rise as Soft Inflation Backs Bets on Two 2025 Fed Rate Cuts
item.description: Shorter-dated US Treasuries gained after benign April inflation data shored up wagers on at least two Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year.
item.dc:creator: Liz Capo McCormick

media:content.media:description: The Marriner S. Eccles Federal Reserve building in Washington, DC.

item.title: AI Boom Helps Score $12 Billion Deal for Little-Known LS Power
item.description: LS Power bet on buying and building natural gas power plants at a time when some analysts considered them almost relics, doomed to be sidelined by solar and wind.
item.dc:creator: Naureen S Malik

item.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq 100 Erase 2025 Drop as Trade Hope Sparks Rebound
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 indexes turned higher for the year on Tuesday, reversing a multitrillion dollar routs, as enthusiasm for US stocks grows with global trade tensions cooling after the Trump administration and China agreed to temporarily lower tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Esha Dey

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Tariff Truce Presents Opportunities in US and China, Says Morgan Stanley
item.description: Christina Au-Yeung, Morgan Stanley Private Wealth Management Asia's head of investment management services, says US exceptionalism is not synonymous with the Magnificent Seven and she sees opportunities for high-net worth investors to dip back into US. She says the tariff truce reached between the US and China presents interesting opportunities to investors in both countries. She spoke with Annabelle Droulers during a fireside chat at Bloomberg's New Voices Hong Kong 2025 launch event. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Lazard's Temple Sees 'World of Opportunity' in Non-US Equities
item.description: Lazard Chief Market Strategist Ronald Temple says being invested in equities is a better place to be than cash over the long run. Speaking on "Bloomberg Open Interest," Temple also says he sees a "world of opportunity" outside of the US. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Robinhood Rival EToro Likely to Price IPO Above Marketed Range
item.description: EToro Group Ltd. is likely to price its US initial public offering above its marketed range, according to a person familiar with the matter, in one of the first deals to resume after the tariff-driven pause.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: The EToro logo on a laptop computer arranged in Dobbs Ferry, New York, U.S., on Saturday, May 22, 2021. Elon Musk continued to toy with the price of Bitcoin Monday, taking to Twitter to indicate support for what he says is an effort by miners to make their operations greener.

item.title: Greece Asks UK Court to Rule on Disputed GDP Warrant Buyback
item.description: Greece is taking a dispute over its GDP warrants to a court in the UK, the latest nation to become embroiled in a battle with holders of the growth-linked debt instruments.
item.dc:creator: Constantine Courcoulas, Jorgelina Do Rosario
